children.subject: I think the competition video link is wrong
Fill out our recruitment form and we'll post info session news later.
Will you be having any info sessions or similar informational events?

history.content:
Hey, look up here!

Robomaster At Berkeley! A novel and exhilarating robotics sports community in Cal is looking for creative, passionate and powerful students to get involved in this hands-on robotics experience.

If you have the experience, or you are interested in Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Algorithms, Mechanical Engineering and Robotics in general, please apply!

Applications are now open. Submit the form below by the end of September 20th at 11:59 pm

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdCzcLh_Q-Q8gm41T8f0zGHyrxvctBwKW9YvM6wmmPqu3pL_A/viewform?usp=sf_link

Also, we are establishing our formal business team. If you have experience in funding and sponsorships, click the link below to apply for business positions.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScGPWRaHnk-4SCr03tVbvy245vBkULWac30m53jcGliHUhy7g/viewform?usp=sf_link

We will compete with other universities around the world in the 2020 ICRA Robomaster AI Challenge. The AI challenge asks teams to build automatic rovers that can sense the environment around themselves, navigate an arena, and engage in combat with the opposing team. Machine learning + Battle gaming? That’s fun robots! For more details, check out our technical report and competition videos!

Technical Report: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nnB_GT3BxzA&feature=youtu.be

Competition Video: https://drive.google.com/open?id=13a90i4f07H4KhEKy_CIoXgS0Nd7FbKBm
